item.title: Feedback on giving a talk
item.description: OMW to my first ever local meetup talk. I will be presenting #Clojure. /me nervous as fuck pic.twitter.com/sFqpDa0Iqz — Arnaud Bos (@arnaud_bos) November 9, 2017 Last week I gave a talk at a local meetup, the Toulouse Java User Group, where I presented Lisp and Clojure. Apart from mandatory workgroup presentations or master thesis defense, I’ve never volunteered to talk in front of people. In the beginning of May 2017, I sent a “Call for paper” to one of our local GDG DevFest and got rejected ¯\(ツ)/¯
